Name: Atomic Condition
Definition: "A condition that does not contain logical operators" (Hamburg and Mogyorodi, 2024)

Name: Cause-Effect Graph
Definition: A "logical network[] that map[s] a set of causes to a set of effects by systematically exploring the possible combinations of input conditions" (Washizaki, 2024, p. 5-11; similar in Hamburg and Mogyorodi, 2024)

Name: Classification Tree
Definition: "A tree diagram representing test data domains of a test object" (Hamburg and Mogyorodi, 2024) as "a decomposition hierarchy" (IEEE, 2017, p. 485; OG PMBOK)

Name: (Software) Component
Definition: A discrete entity, either structurally (IEEE, 2017, p. 419; OG ISO/IEC, 2015), functionally, or logically (IEEE, 2017, p. 419), "within a system considered at a particular level of analysis" (ISO/IEC, 2023; IEEE, 2017, p. 419; OG ISO/IEC, 2015) "that can be tested in isolation" (Hamburg and Mogyorodi, 2024); "the individual subprograms or components, a subsystem, or a composition of … components" (Washizaki, 2024, p. 5-6) or even an entire system (IEEE, 2017, p. 419; OG ISO/IEC, 2016)

Name: Decision Table
Definition: A "tabular representation of decision rules between causes and effects" (IEEE, 2022, p. 3) or of "sets of conditions and the actions resulting from them" (IEEE, 2017, p. 123)

Name: Extended Entry Table
Definition: A "decision table where the conditions and actions are generally described but are incomplete" (IEEE, 2017, p. 175; OG ISO, 1984)

Name: Functional Unit
Definition: An "entity … capable of accomplishing a specified purpose" (IEEE, 2017, p. 196) that is "logically separable" (IEEE, 2017, p. 489) and "not subdivided" (IEEE, 2017, p. 489; OG ISO/IEC, 2012)

Name: Keyword
Definition: "One or more words [including "at least one verb"] used as a reference to a specific set of actions intended to be performed during" testing (IEEE, 2022, p. 5)
Synonym(s): Action Word (implied by Hamburg and Mogyorodi, 2024)

Name: Metamorphic Relation
Definition: A "description of how changes to the test inputs for a test case affect the expected outputs" (IEEE, 2022, p. 6; similar in Hamburg and Mogyorodi, 2024)

Name: Mixed Entry Table
Definition: A "decision table whose stub consists of rows in which limited and extended entries are written" (IEEE, 2017, p. 278; OG ISO, 1984)

Name: Multiple-hit Decision Table
Definition: A "decision table where at least one set of conditions will be satisfied by more than one rule" (IEEE, 2017, p. 285; OG ISO, 1984)

Name: Regression Analysis
Definition: "An analytic technique where a series of input variables are examined in relation to their corresponding output results in order to develop a mathematical or statistical relationship" (IEEE, 2017, p. 372)

Name: Single-hit Decision Table
Definition: A "decision table where any set of conditions will be satisfied by one, and only one, rule" (IEEE, 2017, p. 415; OG ISO, 1984)

Name: (Software) Unit
Definition: An "atomic-level software component of the software architecture that can be subjected to stand-alone testing" (Washizaki, 2024, p. 10-3; IEEE, 2017, p. 428; OG ISO/IEC, 2016) that is "separately compilable" (IEEE, 2017, p. 428; OG ISO/IEC, 2008), "logically separable" (IEEE, 2017, p. 489), and "not subdivided" (IEEE, 2017, p. 489; OG ISO/IEC, 2012)
